topic.title: Test draft-comment
topic.shortdesc: This should test all of the attributes people can use on draft-comment, as if they would really want to use such a thing. The tests must occur inside of paragraphs, because comments cannot be children of <body>.

body.section: Try putting a draft comment in a sectionBecause I recall somebody doing that once, and it caused problems. This is a draft-comment.

section.draft-comment:
Any draft comment should of course start with basic text. Followed by other stuff. As for the other stuff, we'll put phrase-level stuff first. test apiname test bold (test boolean ->) test cite test cmdname test codeph test filepathtest italic test inline image: test keyword test menucascade/uicontrol test msgnum test msgph [skipping object] test option test parmname test ph testing a quote (test state -> ) test sub test sup test synph test systemoutput test term tm to amazon test tt test underlined test uicontrol test uicontrol/shortcut test userinput test varname test wintitle test xref to the top
Now I will add the block-like elements, in reverse order:
test ul
